metadata.Title: CVE-2018-8014 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The defaults settings for the CORS filter provided in Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.8, 8.5.0 to 8.5.31, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.52, 7.0.41 to 7.0.88 are insecure and enable 'supportsCredentials' for all origins. It is expected that users of the CORS filter will have configured it appropriately for their environment rather than using it in the default configuration. Therefore, it is expected that most users will not be impacted by this issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-8014` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.1-java - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1.2
libtomcat8-embed-java - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1.2
libtomcat8-java - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1.2
tomcat8 - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1.2
tomcat8-admin - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1.2
tomcat8-common - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1.2
tomcat8-examples - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1.2
tomcat8-user - 8.5.30-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat8 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.5.30-1ubuntu1.2').
